result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Savion Dalton

records.addlTxt: Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($750.00) LW

Pretrial Services Discharge Report, received and filed
bench warrant status

Defendant Antonio Savion Dalton not in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Antonio Savion Dalton.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a plea and sentencing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. COURT FORFEITS BAIL.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Antonio Savion Dalton not in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Antonio Savion Dalton.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in Court for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court adjourns matter for a calendar call/plea and sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of a global offer from the State, which includes 21CM3761. Court accepted this case into Branch 19.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Savion Dalton in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Dennis Murphy for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court allows for transfer to Branch 19 for global resolution.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Savion Dalton in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Court in trial on another matter. Defense requests plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.  
Case set for status 2/22/2022. Milwaukee County Office of Emergency Management declared a snow emergency for 2/22/2022 therefore this matter will be rescheduled. A new date has been selected with Attorney Wait by telephone. Case is adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with Donte B., Brenna C., Erica S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Pretrial Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Antonio Savion Dalton in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Antonio Savion Dalton in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Br. 28. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 28 for pretrial.  Status conference scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
